### printInst() {#a8cc6456341bfdabe06420c258f14ca0e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;DirectXMCTargetDesc.cpp&#125;::DXILInstPrinter::printInst (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinst">MCInst</a> &#42; MI, uint64&#95;t Address, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Annot, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcsubtargetinfo">MCSubtargetInfo</a> &amp; STI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp; OS)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Print the specified MCInst to the specified raw&#95;ostream.

<code>Address</code> the address of current instruction on most targets, used to print a PC relative immediate as the target address. On targets where a PC relative immediate is relative to the next instruction and the length of a MCInst is difficult to measure (e.g. x86), this is the address of the next instruction. If Address is 0, the immediate will be printed.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/directx/lib/target/directx/mctargetdesc/directxmctargetdesc-cpp/#l00053">53</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/directx/lib/target/directx/mctargetdesc/directxmctargetdesc-cpp">DirectXMCTargetDesc.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
